title: [Textile] XSS in project README files

profile.name: GitLab
profile.about: A single application for the entire software development lifecycle.

vulnerability_information:
Hi,

Another parser bypass here – I discovered that Textile markup can be used to inject a stored JavaScript payload into a project `README.textile` file :)

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new GitLab project
2. Initialise the project by creating a `README` file
3. Set the file title to `README.textile`
4. Paste the below Payload into the file
5. Commit the file to the project and click on the link

## Proof of Concept Payload

```
"Security test link":javascript:alert(document.domain)
```

Thanks!
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi,

Another parser bypass here – I discovered that Textile markup can be used to inject a stored JavaScript payload into a project README.textile file :)

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Create a new GitLab project
  2. Initialise the project by creating a README file
  3. Set the file title to README.textile
  4. Paste the below Payload into the file
  5. Commit the file to the project and click on the link

Proof of Concept Payload

"Security test link":javascript:alert(document.domain)

Thanks!

activities.message:
@ysx,

This finding will also be covered by the patch going out later this week. I'll update all of these issues when the patch is released. Thanks again!
activities.markdown_message:
@ysx,

activities.message:
I just wanted to let you know that we released a patch for this vulnerability today: https://about.gitlab.com/2017/02/15/gitlab-8-dot-16-dot-5-security-release/

Thanks again for the great work!

(I'll be spamming this across all three of your reports ;)

activities.message: As with #200693, would it be possible to publicly disclose this report please? Thanks!
activities.markdown_message: As with #200693, would it be possible to publicly disclose this report please? Thanks!

activities.message: Absolutely. I'll mark them all as public.
activities.markdown_message: Absolutely. I'll mark them all as public.

summaries.content: Persistent XSS vulnerabilities were identified by way of the RubyDoc, reStructuredText, and Textile markup formats. Thanks again to the GitLab team. I've published a [blogpost](https://ysx.me.uk/lightweight-markup-a-trio-of-persistent-xss-in-gitlab) discussing my findings and the recent Security Release.
summaries.content_html: Persistent XSS vulnerabilities were identified by way of the RubyDoc, reStructuredText, and Textile markup formats. Thanks again to the GitLab team. I've published a blogpost discussing my findings and the recent Security Release.
